intro: Amyema ferruginiflora, commonly known as the rusty-flowered amyema, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink, often with a reddish tinge. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in a fine, rusty-colored pubescence, giving it a distinctive appearance. Amyema ferruginiflora is typically found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to withstand arid conditions.
